description:

Cinquantenaire Park is very centrally located, and even though it is smaller than the other parks, it will be just right for a beginners' run.

Our meeting point is the parking lot in front of Autoworld, next to the fountain.

description:
Let's try something new this time. Some of you were interested in rollerblading, and this park seems to be the place for it.

In case you don't have your own gear (like me), you can rent it at this sports store right next to the park: http://www.twin-shop.be

Roller rentals are €5 per hour, €15 per day.

In case you are a complete beginner (also like me), be assured that this is a beginner friendly meeting and we'll try to keep everyone alive.

Our meeting point is, as always, the traffic circle at the end of Avenue Louise. If any of you prefer to meet at Twin-Shop instead, let me know.

See you on Saturday!

description:
Whether you’re Belgian or not, on this special day you can honor King and Country with a royal 30-40 minute run in Parc Royal a.k.a. Warandepark / Parc de Bruxelles.

For the occasion it would be appropriate of course to wear a waving Belgian flag or a Tintin costume, but that’s optional.

I suggest Antoine’s on Place Jourdan for tasty Belgian fries afterwards!
how_to_find_us: Our meeting point is the southeast corner of the park, facing the Royal Palace and Trone metro station.
name: Patriotic Holiday Run in Parc Royal

description:
After so many runs in Brussels, it is time for something a little more adventurous! Like a trip to Natura Parc, by Lac de la Plate Taille, in the scenic Ardennes countryside.

The park has a variety of adventure courses up in the trees, from easy to scary, and for extra thrill a Tyrolean traverse across the lake! After which we will probably need a solid lunch.

Check out details and pictures on the website: www.naturaparc.be

The price is 21 euros (cash only) and that includes 3 hours of access to the park, equipment rental, safety introduction and guidance. They will ask for IDs as a deposit for the rented equipment.

Reservations are highly recommended by the operators, so I will reserve for however many people have RSVP'ed by Tuesday the 19th. If we hit 15 we'll get a discount! ;)

We can organize the trip using cars (it's about a 90 minute drive), although the park can be reached by train via Charleroi as well. I can give up to 3 people a lift.

For any questions you can always email me.

Let's hope for sunny weather!
how_to_find_us: Meet at the park entrance by 11am. Please post a message to share transportation from Brussels.
name: Natura Parc Adventure

description:
Hi Runners,

Sorry for the late announcement but maybe some of you are still interested in the roller parade on Friday. Get your skates out of the basement for a fun rolling tour around the city!

The parade takes place every Friday during the summer months (when the weather allows for it). Starting at Place Poelaert, it takes you around town for about three hours with a few hundred or even thousand other skaters. During the event, the rollers own the road and police make sure that traffic doesn't get in the way.

No fee, no registration, you can simply show up!

http://www.belgiumrollers.com/
how_to_find_us: Let's meet up at the column on Place Poelaert a few minutes before 8.
name: Roller Skating Parade

description:
Another fun run is coming up - the Acerta Ekiden relay! Teams of 6 will be running a combined[masked] km marathon distance in Laeken, divided in:

Runner 1 - 5 km
Runner 2 - 10 km
Runner 3 - 5 km
Runner 4 - 10 km
Runner 5 - 5 km
Runner 6 - 7.195 km

The registration fee is €120 per team or €180 with T-shirts.
More details here: http://www.acertabrus...

This year there will also be a UNICEF tent at the relay, to raise funds for crisis relief at the Horn of Africa. Fabio (Xang) is organizing an Expats for UNICEF running team for this initiative, and you can support it and run under their colors if you wish. Here is more info: http://www.facebook.c...

Please only sign up for the relay if you know you can participate that day, as your team depends on you. Lastly, the teams will do the actual registration on the Ekiden website themselves so this meetup event is only a tool to put the teams together!

See you at the race!
name: Acerta Brussels Ekiden and Expats for UNICEF

description:
Tuesday is a bank holiday. I'd like to take this opportunity to run the 5KM marked route in the Forêt de Soignes, starting near the Rouge Cloitre. I did the 10KM route there today, the forest is beautiful: green, yellow and orange, the paths are mostly soft forest ground (also known as "mud" but it should stay dry in the morning - no guarantee though). I've been in these woods several times so we won't get lost.

We'll meet at the east exit of the Hermann Debroux metro station, because it's an easy meeting point. From there it's 1.5 KM to the start of the forest path. If you come by car, you can also park at the car park right under the E411 near the Topolina restaurant. That's where we start the actual trail.

Have a look here to see the trails:

http://www.soignes-zonien.net/que-fait-on-e...

(p.s. forget about the point on this map marked "Départ/Vertrek", we will ignore this)

I think most people will prefer the 5KM trail, but there is the option to run 10 or 20 KM instead, but only if everyone agrees. By default we will do the 5KM trail.
name: Tuesday 1 Nov bank holiday: Autumn forest run in Forêt de Soignes

description: Let's have another morning run to wake us up! We will run a slow to moderate pace, for around 30 minutes.
name: Early morning run in Cinquantenaire park

description:
Let's have another fall forest run on the beautiful trail we did on Tuesday with Auke. Fall colors are still looking wild and the weather should be fair! It's a very nice part of the woods with a marked 5, 10 or 20 km trail, starting near Rouge-Cloître.

From Hermann-Debroux (the closest metro stop), the car park under E411 is 1.5 km down Chaussée de Wavre (our meeting point and where the trail starts).

Here is a trail map: http://www.soignes-zonien.net/que-fait-on-e...

Which distance we choose will depend on who's coming and what they want to do. Don't hesitate if you'd just like a 5 km beginners' run. 10 or 20 if everyone prefers that.

See you there!
name: 5, 10 or 20 km run in Forêt de Soignes

description:
A running/biking combo race is coming up! The way it works is you share a bike in a team of two, racing the distance together (7.8 or 15.6 km on both paved and dirt roads) and switching as fits you best. Registration costs €14 online or €16 (per team) at the race.

Here you can find more information, a trail map, pictures from last year's race and the registration form: http://www.cxl6.be/...

It's best to give a rough indication of your running level in the RSVP so we can organize the teams, and please let us know if you have a bike!

description:
Another run & bike race is coming up soon! You share a bike with your team partner, one running while the other rides the bike. You can switch as you choose, to keep a good overall speed. Even more fun than running and biking on their own!

Here is the website (in French) with more information, a trail map, elevation profile and the registration form:

http://www.promorunbike.be/site1/index.php  

Never mind the missing age categories. According to the organizers, adults are allowed to participate. They will have showers, changing rooms, a bike wash and food (spaghetti, need to reserve) available. Registration costs €8 online or €10 at the race.

Sign up here if you'd like to try this. We can then figure out teams and who will bring bikes. We also need to organize transportation to Grez-Doiceau, as it is about 40 km from Brussels and public transport doesn't seem to be an easy option.

Let's go and sign up a team or two!

The course is for a minimum of 4 people, at €12/person/hour, min €60.

Close to Demey metro stop.

description:
...because run&bikes are twice as nice. The distance is 15 km this time, 22.5 km is also available. Many of the teams that sign up for events in this series are rather experienced and competitive (they even call it a championship), but that does not take away from the fun even if this is your first event of this kind!

We'll use this meetup to find team partners and organize bike sharing and transportation.

All details here: http://www.promorunbi...
name: Brussels Run and Bike

description:
Since there is more appetite for climbing after the intro last Friday, I suggest we go again on Sunday! 

If you were there last week and feel safe enough, or you've climbed before, you're good to go and have fun on the walls. For the rest we'll go over the basics of the equipment, safety rules, climbing and belaying techniques, and practice in the bouldering area before moving on to the walls.

Access to the gym is €8.50 and equipment can be rented for €5. All you need to bring is courage and comfortable sports clothing.

http://newrockescalade.be

Close to Demey metro stop.
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description: Find out how great it feels to run in the fresh air of Bois de la Cambre in the evening! We will run for about 1 hour at moderate pace (9 km/h). Bring a head- or flashlight if you have one. Meeting point: Next to the roundabout at the end of Av. Louise.
name: evening run in Bois de la Cambre

description: Paris half-marathon - 30,000 runners, 21.1km, Paris in the springtime... http://www.semidepari...
name: Semi de Paris

description: A moderately paced run in the hilly park, around 7 km. Our meeting point is the pond by Bemelstraat (the closest tram stop is Chien Vert). Bring a headlamp if you have one!
name: 40 Minute Run in Woluwe Park

description: Another run around sunrise to wake us up for the day! It will be a 30 minute run at an easy pace.
name: Morning Run in Cinquantenaire Park

description:
Here goes climbing session #3!

As I said last time, those of you who were there already, and are already comfortable climbing, are all set to go and have fun on the walls. For the rest we'll go over the basics of the equipment, safety rules, climbing and belaying techniques, and practice in the bouldering area before moving on to the walls.

Access to the gym is €8.50 and equipment can be rented for €5. All you need to bring is courage and comfortable sports clothing.

http://newrockescalade.be

Close to Demey metro stop.
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description: For those who don't want to run an entire Strandmarathon, let's run in Bois de la Cambre / Foret de Soignes! Moderate pace - around 9 km/h. Meeting at traffic rundabout at the end of Av. Louise. Next year we'll do the marathon.
name: Runday sun

description: Point-to-point beach marathon on the coast between Den Haag (The Hague) and Amsterdam. http://www.schevening...
name: Strandmarathon, Scheveningen-Zandvoort

description:
Another run at sunrise to wake us up for the day! It will be a 30 minute run at an easy pace.

If you're a bit late and miss us, just wait for us at the west gate. We'll be running by it a few times till 7:30.
name: Morning Run in Cinquantenaire Park

description: not too slow, not too fast = 9-10 km/h. about 1 h. meeting at roundabout at the end of avenue louise.
name: run in ze forest / saturday morning

description:
Another run around sunrise to wake us up for the day! It will be a 30 minute run at an easy pace.

If you're a bit late and miss us, just wait at the west gate. We'll be running by there a few times till 7:30.
name: Morning Run in Cinquantenaire Park

description: A moderately paced run in the hilly park, around 7 km. Our meeting point is the pond by Bemelstraat (the closest tram stop is Chien Vert). Bring a headlamp if you have one, it's still dark at the evening runs!
name: 40 Minute Run in Woluwe Park

description: A little March madness for the longer distance enthusiast. A trail run ending at the Eiffel Tower in the heart of Paris. http://www.traildepar...
name: Trail de Paris - 18k/30k/50k/80k

description:
Climbing at New Rock, close to Demey metro.

If we have new people joining again we will do an introduction to go over the basics of the equipment, safety rules, climbing and belaying techniques. Everybody else: hit the walls, climb, fall, climb again, have fun! I would like to do some more bouldering this time as well, maybe with teams spotting each other to take advantage of that area of the gym. Later on, if you want to stick around let's go for pizza or other well-deserved climbers' dinner.

Access to the gym is €8.50 and equipment can be rented for €5. All you need to bring is courage and comfortable sports clothing.

http://newrockescalade.be
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description:
We'll head out into Forêt de Soignes from Bois de la Cambre like we did last week, for about an hour at around 10 km/h.

For those interested in the group T-shirt we're about to get printed, I have a few blank sample shirts in different sizes, which I will bring to the run so you can try them on. I'm going to have them at the run in Woluwe Park today and climbing on Saturday as well.
name: Forest Run & T-Shirt Try-On

description: A relaxed evening run, about 1 h, max 10 km/h. No flashlights required anymore, sundown is after 20.00 now!! meeting at the roundabout at the end of Avenue Louise.
name: Bois de la Cambre / Foret de Soigne

description:
"after the long run we are all dead."
John Maynard Keynes

In order to start training for the Brussels 20k in May, I plan to go way down south into Foret de Soignes, doing about the same distance as in that race, but at a much slower pace (9 km/h).

We will go to a place calles "Ganzepootvijver" which translates as "Goose Leg Pond". Map: http://g.co/maps/cj7qk

From there, it is a few 100 m to civilisation, or at least to places like www.ariosa.be where we should be able to get something to drink. I will invite everybody who made it to there.

After that, we will go back to Av. Louise. Total duration should be 2:30 h or so.

Meeting point: Rundabout at end of Av. Louise.

Looking foraward to seeing you!
name: serious run in Foret de Soignes - 20 km

description: 10km per hour pace. Meet at the ferry crossing across from chalet Robinson at 18:30.
name: 10 run in boot de la Cambre and forest

description:
some of you already know this run: It starts at the traffic roundabout at end of Av. Louise, goes through Bois de la Cambre to "Etang de Fer de Cheval" in the Foret de Soignes (a small pond just south of Golf course) and back.

11 kilometers at moderate speed, 10 km/h.

To Mehdi: Sorry, no drinks included this time.
name: yet another forest run

description:
Some of you already know this run: It starts at the traffic roundabout at end of Av. Louise, goes through Bois de la Cambre to "Etang de Fer de Cheval" in the Foret de Soignes (a small pond just south of Golf course) and back.

±10 kilometers at moderate speed, 10 km/h.
name: Run in Bois de La Cambre

description: 18:00 or a bit earlier, 10k/hr pace. meet at the ferry point infront of chateaux Robinson. Atef[masked]
name: 10k run Saturday (today 7/4) at 18:00 or possibly earlier in Boit de la Cambre

description: Rumor has it that there are people who stay in Brussels over Easter. If you're one of them, how about a day hike in the Ardennes? No detailed plans for this one yet - I would drive to Dinant and hit the hiking trails there along the river and in the valleys, but am open to suggestions if you know a good trail somewhere else! Going on Monday instead is an option as well.
name: Ardennes Easter Weekend Hike

description: would like to burn off some Easter food with a 10km run at around 11km/hr pace. I usually run around Bois de la Cambre but would like to try something different: any suggestions? I have a car, so if it's outside Brussels I can also get there (and take up to 4 people with me)
name: 10km run on Monday (April 9th) at 16:00

description:
This can be a training run for the upcoming Antwerp 10 miles. I would do it by distance on a fixed route, and see what time we end up with. It is a group run though, meaning it doesn't matter if you're not the fastest runner. We will do it to start training for longer distances.

If you have been at Woluwe Park you know it's hilly, which adds nicely to the training effect!

Our meeting point is the pond by Bemelstraat.
name: 12k Run in Woluwe Park

description:
Let's go climbing at New Rock again! Optional late dinner for survivors. That means we'd stay at the gym for around two hours to find a pizza place or pub as we did before.

Let's work some more on the technique this time and see what grades of routes we can manage. At the last session I think hardly anyone fell, so there's room for the ambitious ones to push ourselves a little more! :)

http://newrockescalade.be
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description: We will start in the Bois de la Cambre and then run through the hippodrome of Boisfort into the Forêt de Soignes!
name: 1 hour run in Bois de la Cambre

description:
I am running this one, so I invite anyone else to face 42,195 km and join me. =)

Start: up Champs-Elysées.

Finish: down Avenue Foch.

Starting time handisports : 8h35 (inscriptions auprès de la Fédération Française Handisport)

marathon : 8h45

Refreshments Every 5 km (water, raisins, oranges and bananas).

Sponges Every 5 km from km 7,5.

Timing Will be shown every 5 km, km 1, km 21,1 and at finish line.

Duration of the race : 5h40.

Medal and certificate for all finishers.

 

More info at: http://www.parismarat...
name: Paris Marathon

description:
Here's the last 12 km training run for the upcoming 10 mile race in Antwerp. I suggest we follow the same trail as last time, and after some warming up / stretching we split up in 2-3 groups so each participant can run at their training speed.

Our meeting point is the pond next to Bemelstraat.
name: 12k Run in Woluwe Park

description:
The Antwerp Marathon is held on Sunday 22 April, start 9:30. There are also other runs you can do:
1.30pm: DVV Antwerp Short Run 5 km
2.30pm: ASICS Ladies Run 5 km
3.30pm: DVV Antwerp 10 Miles

I'm running the marathon, I can give 3 people a ride in my car but for the way back to Brussels I won't wait for people who do runs other than the marathon.

URL for all details and registration:
http://sport.be.msn.com/runningtour/antwerp...
Program:
7.30am: Opening registrations
9.30am: DVV Antwerp Marathon
1.00pm: Chiquita Kids Run 1 km (6-12 years old)
1.30pm: DVV Antwerp Short Run 5 km
2.30pm: ASICS Ladies Run 5 km
3.30pm: DVV Antwerp 10 Miles

Location to pick up the startnumbers:
Charles de Costerlaan, near intersection with Gloriantlaan, Antwerpen

Parcours marathon:
http://www.garmin.be/Parcours/Antwerp10Mile...
Parcours 10 miles:
http://www.garmin.be/Parcours/Antwerp10Mile...
name: Antwerp Marathon 09:30, 10 Miles 15:30

description: Let's have a morning run again to wake us up and recover any hurting legs from Antwerp 10 miles or marathon!
name: Morning run at Cinquantanaire

description: Starting as usual at the traffic circle at end of Avenue Louise, let's go for a 45-60 minute run in Bois de la Cambre. No special training, just a casual after-work run.
name: Run in Bois de La Cambre

description:
A different kind of run for the more adventurous: the organizers call this one a survival run. It's not primarily about time, but finishing the 10k with all its obstacles, individually or as a team. http://sport.be.msn.c...

Some pictures so you get an idea what to expect: http://sport.be.msn.c...

You may have seen the Total Warrior Challenge in England later this year that I posted. If you're interested in going to that, the Spartacus Run will be your test!
name: Spartacus Run

description: A run to be combined with a nice trip to Knokke. Three different distances: 4K, 6.5K and 10K (and a Chiquita run for the kids). Functional T-shirt available for those interested.
name: Knokke 10K

description:
Let's have another indoor climbing session (about 2 hours) at New Rock, and perhaps a snack afterwards.

We can do the usual program - warmup and bouldering, repetition of techniques if needed, climbing on lower ropes, then high ropes the main room.

http://newrockescalade.be
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description:
Beautiful race and ambiance! It will be my third! More info:http://www.genevemara...

The parcours is much flatter that the one of last year!
name: Geneva Half Marathon

description:
This is a great part of the forest with marked 5, 10 and 20 km distances, starting near Rouge-Cloître. Here's a map: http://www.soignes-zonien.net/que-fait-on-e...

My suggestion is we run the 10 km at a moderate pace.

From Hermann-Debroux metro stop, the trailhead (where we meet) is 1.5 km down Chaussée de Wavre, by the car park under the E411 highway.
name: 10 km Run in Forêt de Soignes

description: Point-to-point marathon around this iconic bay, finishing on the beautiful island of Mont St. Michel. The only significant hill is in the first couple of km. http://www.montsaintm...
name: Mont St. Michel Marathon

description:
Our relay marathon experiences have been great so far, and here's another one coming up in Namur! Each team consists of 6 runners, covering different distances:

Runner 1: 5 km
Runner 2: 10 km
Runner 3: 5 km
Runner 4: 10 km
Runner 5: 5 km
Runner 6: 7.195 km

Changing rooms and showers are available. Registration costs €30 per team.

http://www.ville.namur.be/page.asp?id=4987
name: Namur Marathon Ekiden

description:
As the Great 20 is approaching, let's bring a few more 10-15 km runs to the training. We can start with the same marked 10 km trail we ran on Thursday, and add a 5 km lap for those who would like to do some more. I'm planning to repeat this on the weekend.

From Hermann-Debroux metro stop, the trailhead (where we meet) is 1.5 km down Chaussée de Wavre, by the car park under the E411 highway.
name: 10+ km Run in Forêt de Soignes

description:
Meet at the ferry point in front of chalet Robinson. The run can be spilt in two parts for those who want to do 5K.

Location: http://g.co/maps/cseqm
name: 10k run  in Boit de la Cambre and Forest

description: The usual, meet at ferry boat across chalet Robinson in boit de la Cambre. Come on people,the 20k is around the corner.
name: 10km run, Friday 18/5 at 4pm boit de la Cambre

description: This place is a large and beautiful patch of forest, perfect for running. It's best accessible by car, and our meeting point is the parking lot on Jezus Eiklaan / Koniklijke Wandeling.
name: 1 Hour Run in Tervuren Arboretum

description:
10Km, could be split in two 5Km loops for those who want a shorter run.
Meet at the ferry point across Chalet Robinson. Check map link:

Map: http://g.co/maps/cseqm
name: moderate pace rub in Boit de Cambre + Forest

description: A slow to medium pace 30 minute run to start the day. We'll start at 7 but if you get to the meeting point (gate) later, you'll still see us there after every lap.
name: Morning Run in Cinquantenaire Park

description: An early wake up run of about 20 to 30 minutes, just 2 days before the 20KM. Hopefully Dominik can bring the T-shirts...?
name: Morning run in Park Cinquantenaire

description:
This is the big one with 30,000 runners. All details here: www.20km.be

Registration opens on March 24 at 9 am. Mark the date because last year all those spots were booked extremely fast!

Most of us are not running this kind of distance often (or at all), so in addition to your individual training I suggest we have some longer group runs (up to around 18 km) in the weeks leading up to the race. As always, it helps the motivation!
name: Brussels 20k

description: A moderately paced run in the hilly parts of Woluwe, around 7 km. Our meeting point is the pond by Bemelstraat (the closest tram stop is Chien Vert).
name: 40 Minute Run in Woluwe Park

description:
Let's have another indoor climbing session (about 2 hours) at New Rock, and, if there are suggestions for places still serving food afterwards, a well-deserved climbers' snack!

We can do the usual program - warmup and bouldering, repetition of techniques if needed, climbing on lower ropes, then high ropes the main room.

Access to the gym is 8.50 euros for the evening, and equipment can be rented for 5 euros.

More info here: http://newrockescalade.be
name: Indoor Climbing Session

description:
Another moderately paced run in the hilly parts of Woluwe, around 7 km. Depending on the number of runners we can split up in two groups so that even the speediest ones can spend all their energy!

Our meeting point is the pond by Bemelstraat as always. The run will take place rain or shine (rain is expected), but not in case of thunderstorm.
name: 40 Minute Run in Woluwe Park

description:
Meet at the circle at the end of Ave Louise for a leisurely bike ride through Foret de Soignes to the Lion's Mound (about 36km roundtrip). We won't visit the museum, but can relax in a restaurant across from the battlefield before biking back, so bring a bike lock. Also, wear a helmet if you have one as we might have to ride on the road for part of the way.
Note: I might get a little "lost" at the other end of the forest, so bear with me.

WHAT YOU NEED: your own bike + water

LIMIT: As we may be riding partly on the road, I would like to limit the number of people to no more than six just to be safe.
name: Bike to Butte du Lion, Waterloo (only if no rain)

description:
A short run of about 20 minutes, at intermediate speed (10-11 km/h).
Meet us at the western gate (near the Parkside Brasserie), we will be doing some stretching exercises near the Summer statue.
name: Morning run in Cinquantenaire park

description:
One or two laps around my favourite park, moderate pace (10-11 km/h). We'll meet at the usual place, the north entrance at the pond in Rue Bemel.
Optional: finish with a run up the Hill to Montgomery on Tervurenlaan from the 20 KM and (half) marathon.
name: Run in Woluwe Park tonight at 19:30

description:
A moderate pace run in and around Boit de la Cambre. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link).

We could head for brunch after.
http://g.co/maps/cseqm
name: 10km run in boit de la cambre +forest

description: Car pool or take the train from Gare central. Quick visit to the town then kayaking down the river Lasse (11 or 22 km) including picnic on the side of the river. The forecast looks good.
name: Day trip Dinant and kayaking down the Lasse

description: To get some more training in readiness for the July activity weekend is anyone keen for some more rock climbing this Friday?
name: Indoor rock climbing

description:
A moderate pace run in and around Boit de la Cambre, about 10km in one hours. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link).
People who want to run less can do so. We could split the run in two 5Km parts.
We could head for brunch after.
http://g.co/maps/cseqm

description: start at the beginning of the 3 courses. Maximum 2h for 20km

description:
Sunny weather predicted. Walk in the Zwin natural reserve and explore the coastal area between Belgium and Holland.
We will car pool, the number of people will depend on cars availability.
We car pool, so places dependent on cars availability. We leave Schumann at 9am.
name: Walk in Zwin and Cadzand (coastal area between Holland and Belgium)

description:
A beautiful 14,7 KM run through the nicest parts of the Zonienwoud/Forêt de Soignes, on Sunday 24 June. It only costs 6 euro to enter (9 euro on the day)

Starting point: Centre Sportif de la forêt de Soignes - chée de Wavre, 2057 à 1160 Auderghem
They warn that there's only limited parking space; metro station Hermann Debroux is 1KM away (there's also a bus 72 but I believe that only runs once per hour).

Website:
http://www.axa-running.be/foulees/acces_et_parcours.php?lang=fr

venue.name: Voetbalplein van Oudergem
venue.address_1: Voetbalplein van Oudergem - Waversteenweg 1854 te 1160 Oudergem

name: Foulées AXA Run, Forêt de Soignes

description:
A short run of 20-30 min at a slow pace.
We can meet for some stretching in front of the statues.
name: Morning run in Cinquantenaire park

description: A moderate pace run in and around Boit de la Cambre, about 10km in one hours. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link). People who want to run less can do so. We could split the run in two 5Km parts. We could head for brunch after. http://g.co/maps/cseqm

We have done this 10 km trail in the forest a few times before, one of the nicest around.

description: Some where in the Ardennes, possible activities climbing, hiking, running, kayaking, mountain biking. Details to follow.

We can meet for some stretching in front of the statues.

description:
A moderate pace run in and around Boit de la Cambre, about 10km in one hour. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link). People who want to run less can do so. We could split the run in two 5Km parts, and then there's the brunch later on.

http://g.co/maps/cseqm
name: Sat 10k run in boit de la cambre+forest

description: Did a half marathon yesterday, so this week is about recovery. If you don't know what a fartlek is, have a look here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fartlek). Nothing hard, we'll just run altogether on feeling, combining jogging with some short accelerations. Start at the usual parking lot under the bridge where the 5K, 10K, etc distances start into the Forêt de Soignes.
name: Fartlek

description: Sunday anyone? There's a few options for indoor walls in Brussels but most close early on a Sunday. We could head to New Rock again (as its open until 10.30pm).
name: Let's go climbing again

description:
Guys, since our biking attempt on Sunday was not really successful, how about joining a mountain biking organized ride (signed route, food/drinks every few kilometers). There is an event by Namur in NANINNE
they offer[masked]km distances, it costs 5 Euros. We could drive from Brussels at 11:00. You could rent bikes in Brussels, or we could find a place close by the starting point. These events are the same in spirit as running races and attract a good crowd. Beginners can do the short distances. Let me know if you have any questions.
name: Mountain biking event

description:
Another moderately paced run in Woluwe, around 7 km.

Same meeting point as always, the pond next to Bemelstraat.
name: 40 Minute Run in Woluwe Park

description:
A moderate pace run - this time at the Tervuren park! As usual about 10 km. Let's meet in front of the gates to the African museum, immediately across Leuvensesteenweg from the end station of tram 44. Depending on the weather and the mood, we could also head out for brunch/lunch afterwards.

<a href="https://maps.google.it/maps?ie=UTF8&cid=11354570938170697002&q=Royal+Museum+for+Central+Africa&iwloc=A&gl=IT&hl=it"></a>https://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&q=50.829610,4.514321+%28Elisabethlaan+2%E2%80%9328,+3080+Tervuren,+Belgium%29
name: Saturday morning run at Tervuren Park (10 am)

description:
Trail race over 22.8 km with 400 meter height gain making it a 27 km equivalent

http://www.challengedelhalle.be/Fiches/Fiche%20Louette.pdf

trail running shoes strongly recommended as well is bringing energy drink and energy bars for during the run

2 hour drive from Brussels but start is at 16.00 so early wake up is not required :)

description: For anyone who considers themselves a beginner or slow runner, let's have a 30 minute jog in Cinquantenaire Park. The meeting point is the west gate, facing Schuman. I will be wearing the orange Brussels Runners T-shirt so you'll see me easily.

description: Some speed training for upcoming races or just to get rid of our excess energy for the day! We can do the marked 10k trail here, running intervals where the trail is suitable and a more relaxed pace where it's not.

description:
Hi all!

The normal Saturday morning run at 10 am. A moderate pace run in Boit de la Cambre, about 10km in one hour. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link). People who want to run less can do so. We could split the run in two 5Km parts.

NOTICE! Remember to reserve Saturday evening free as we will be saying our fond goodbyes to Marco at St Gerry!

Trail race with two person teams, check out video clip on website

31km or 16km with 1400 respective 640 height gain. The 31km round is part of Belgian trail racing championship

At the beginning of courses adeps, under the bridge.

2 hours maximum, 10-12 km/h

Hi all. The normal Saturday run takes place at 10 am.

A moderate pace run in and around Boit de la Cambre, about 10km in one hour. We meet in front of the Chalet Robinson ferry point (see map link). People who want to run less can do so. If there is need, it is possible to split the run to 5 km as well.

As I have my little sister with me, won't be organising brunch this weekend.

http://g.co/maps/cseqm
name: Sat 10k run in boit de la cambre+forest

description:
A very different kind of running event that takes place in England's Lake District in August 2012 - this is a 10 km or 10 mile course that includes a number of natural and artificial obstacles, of the mean kind. It does sound insane and it probably is. See for yourselves: http://www.totalwarri...

Even though the event is still months away, it makes sense to book transportation and accommodation already if you would like to go. Entry fees are also the lowest until March 8, 2012 (£47 for the 10k) but registration is open until July 27.

As is mentioned on the website, some of the obstacles will be much easier to overcome as a team working together. This will add even more fun to the challenge, although it is possible to sign up individually.

Finally, the best preparation for it is, of course, lots of forest runs!
name: Total Warrior Challenge

description:
http://traildescroix.be/

35km trail with 800 meter height gain making it a 43km equivalent. Also a 13 km version
name: TRAIL DES CROIX (FRANCHEVILLE)

description:
I just registered for the following run in Kortenbeek (about 20 min by car from Brussels). There is also a 6 km track. If anyone cares to join, don't hesitate...

Info is in Dutch here : http://www.excuusfeesten.be/ (registration in the green upper right box). I can translate if you need to.

Fee is 4€ (5€ if you pay on the day itself).

description:
Don't want to interfere with the already scheduled "Easy Run at Cinquantenaire", but still put it up if anyone would like to do both. Usually, I do my interval trainings alone, but let's give it a try...

10’[masked] – 1x (12x 30’’ fast – 30’’ cool) – 10’[masked]
Total is 32 minutes.
Numbers are heart rates,[masked] is very slow warm up/cool down jogging.

Fast means really fast. But fast is different for each. That's why it's better to do it on a short looped track. Let's meet up under the arch at the flag. From there, we'll go to the path around the part you can see the highway below. We'll be running at own pace, but still can motivate each other on this short track.

Should be finished right before the other meetup.
name: Interval training - Cinquantenaire

description: Meet under the arch by the flag. We run about 45 minutes at an easy pace.

description: Bois de La Cambre is an excellent place to run especially on a Sunday when they shut the road. Just follow Avenue Louise until the end and there is the park. If you want to extend your run, you can hop over the road to Forest de Soignes, huge area of forest. Bois de la Cambre is just about runable in the dark too, provided you stick to the edge. My favorite park to run in is Tervuren as it is a flat 5km loop around the lakes and through the trees.

description:
Race info

Will you be one of the first brave souls to accept the challenge of
the Trolls X’trem Run on 1st September 2012 ???

A race over 12km with various obstacles and traps of all sorts to make you lose your cool !
Water, mud, tires, straw bales, nets, ropes and other surprises are awaiting you on that crazy day.
You’ll need a lot of strength and courage to arrive at the finish of this extraordinary race.
But the Trolls X’Trem Run is also about fun, so don’t hesistate to come disguised.
Our little trolls will be there to immortalize you when you do your most acrobatic moves.

Get in contact with your friends immediately and talk to them about this race.

You have been warned, the troll is out to get you !!!

More pictures on www.facebook.com/TrollsXtremRun

http://www.trollsxtremrun.com/
name: TROLLS XTREM RUN

description:
As every year in September, great international athletes participate to Memorial Van Damme, even Bolt and Blake! Some 45 euro seats remain at the time I'm writing so if you want to join, please tell me as soon as possible (if we want to sit close to each other, I have to make the booking for all of us at the same time). 45 euros + 2 euro booking fees. For once, time to relax and watch THEM run!

http://www.diamondleague-brussels.com/en/Home/
name: Memorial Van Damme

description:
Hi everyone, I would like to organise a day trip to the Ardennes to go mountain biking.
There are lots of nice places to go biking in the Ardennes. I have been to Malmedy and really enjoyed it. The scenery is great and some parts of the trails can even be a bit technical (for Belgian/Ardennes standards at least).
You should have a good condition, which I guess should not be a problem in this group, and the more technical parts are generally relatively short, so if you have to walk them it’s not a problem.
You can rent bikes for about 25€ the day! I did not have the best experiences yet, but there is another shop that looks promising (more info later). If you have your own and can bring it there, even better!
The track I have in mind is about 35km long with a total ascent of 560m. Depending on the group we can also chose a longer track, but I think this is a good start.
I will leave Brussels by car at 8h30 in the morning to be in Malmedy around 10h00. I think the parking at Place du Parc is free and close to the bike shop, so I suggest meeting there.
It would be great if we could organise some car sharing.
name: Mountain-biking in Malmedy (Ardennes close to Spa)

description:
Saturday morning forest run takes place at 11 am, after which we can enjoy the early fall sunshine on a nice and relaxed picnic in the park! (We can store the food and blankets in the cars.)

As usual, the actual run will be more-or-less 10 km in the forest, going to the hippodrome and back. Those who want to run less (or more) can do it as well. So we can divide the group to two, if requested.

The meeting point is in front of the ferry: http://g.co/maps/cseqm

See you tomorrow!

description:
http://www.laprovinciale.be/

Trial race over 25km or 46km. The 25km race is Belgian Championship over short distance. Height gain not so clear but think around 900m for the 25km an double for 46km making it 34km and 55km equivalent.
name: Lets go on Trial, La provinciale, Mirwart

description:
11KM run at 11:00: Run 4,5 KM uphill to the Citadel of Namur for a "breathtaking" view over the city, then 4,5 KM downhill and 2KM flat, back to the city centre. The website says it's 11,7 KM but last year we measured it because we thought it felt shorter, and I came to 11,1 actually.

Costs: early birds up to 2 September: 7 euro; on the day: 9

There is also a 5KM run for 3 euro (5 on the day).

NOTE: the 5KM starts at 10:00, the 11KM at 11:00.

 

"Functional" T-shirt is available for 10 euro.

Website:
http://sport.be.msn.com/runningtour/joggingvilledenamur/2012/nl/

There is free parking available under the Hotel du Ville. Last year there was no luggage dropoff, only a few lockers, but if you meet me I can stash it in the ING tent where some of my colleagues can keep an eye on it (still at your own responsibility of course).
Let me know if you want a ride.
name: Jogging Ville de Namur, 11,1 & 5 KM

description:
Finally, another run & bike race will take place in the area! In this one the distances are 8.8 or 15.1 km, and it will be a fairly small event, limited to 70 teams.

More information, including contact info to sign up by email:
Dutch http://www.fetesdeseptembre.be/Folders/FolderR&BNL.pdf
French http://www.fetesdeseptembre.be/Folders/FolderR&BFR.pdf

In run & bikes, teams consist of two people sharing one bike, switching between running and biking at whatever rhythm they like. The team partners must stay within a few meters of each other.
name: Run & Bike

Costs 10KM: 13 euro pre-inscription (up to & incl Monday 10 Sept), 16 on the day
5KM: 9 euro pre-inscription, 12 on the day
As usual you can buy a "functional" T-shirt for 10 euro.

The finish is on the Grote Markt / Grand Place, with free buses to take the runners back to the start.
Free parking is available at the Sportspark, but they close it at 14:00 so be on time. I have no idea if it's easy to park outside (I know, this is Belgium, you can probably drop it somewhere but I can't guarantee it).
I can give 3 people a ride.

The website promises bag dropoff and reliable KM & time measuring (yeah, we know about the reliable KM signs).

The route is different each year and the distance slightly changes too: this time, we'll run 14,8 km from Saint Herblain to Nantes city centre. But the goal of the race is to celebrate the city tramway so part of the race is along the tram lines. Just know that you need a certificate from the doctor to participate in races in France. Deadline to register is 22nd of September. The website is in French so if you need help, do not hesitate to contact me.

http://www.lesfouleesnantaises.fr/

description:
Here is your chance to climb 466 stairs up to the top of the Sheraton Brussels Hotel. It takes around 5 minutes for the average person to climb to the top of the 30 floors. When you register, you have to choose one of the 3 slots available: 9-10am/10-11am/11am-noon. It's 15 euros, it's for UNICEF and if you're the fastest male and female, you will win one night each month for a year at the hotel! I did it last year, it's fun, well organized and you have a nice view over Brussels when you reach the top (once you get your breath back, you can enjoy it!) Here is the link to register http://bibtiming.be/registration/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=51nullnull

I chose the 11am-noon slot. For those interested, we can meet at 11am at Parc Royal for a 15 minute run in order to warm up (and we can keep on running until the hotel, it's close). Meeting point : main entrance of the park, place des Palais, just across the Palace entrance. Please specify if you join the warm up run when you sign up! One last thing, they suggest a lunch up there for less than 10 euros, you can register online or the day of the race.
name: Stairclimbing Race at Sheraton Hotel Rogier

Hello, group, let’s go to a marathon relay!

This run consists of 6 laps of 7 kms each. It looks pretty "natury" (though not a trail).
You can participate either individually or in a group of 2-6 people (if less than 6, someone has to run more laps of course). Inscription is EUR 15 for an individual and EUR 36 for a group.

Inscription is until 6 December, so we should decide on the teams by that time, so when signing up please indicate how many laps you would like to run!


Webpage is https://sites.google.com/site/marathonkampenhout/praktisch
(it's a little bit in Dutch, but google translate helps much)
And you can watch a video about the event here: https://sites.google.com/site/marathonkampenhout/gallery/videos

description:
Hi Runners,

4 days left of the old year - I hope you all had wonderful holidays and are looking forward to your New Year's celebrations in Brussels or elsewhere. 2012 has been great. We've had 235 events this year, everything from half-hour beginners' runs to interval training, organized races, climbing sessions and multi-activity weekends.

Thanks to everyone who organized these events, especially Atef, Ágnes and Saana. Let's keep it up and add even more activities next year!

Let's make the first run of the new year (so far) a run for everyone, in the forest in Auderghem where we've had quite a few 5-20k runs already. I suggest the 10k trail at a medium speed. It will be a run for all levels so if needed we will split up in two groups and meet again at the end for stretching.

See you there!

Dominik

description:
I'm part of the organising team for the second edition of the Sierra Leone Marathon and am helping arrange a meeting in Brussels this Thursday for those who want to find out more, and I thought some of your guys might be interested!

The marathon is taking place on 26 May 2013 this year in Makeni, Sierra Leone, and the goal is raise money for Street Child, a charity which helps children in Sierra Leone off the street and into school.

This marathon isn't for the faint-hearted - but last year, we had 386 runners from 20 different countries (including Belgium!) and they had the adventure of a lifetime. Also - they all finished in one piece! The event has 5k, half marathon and full marathon races available, and flights go direct to Sierra Leone from Brussels. The track is mostly flat, in the beautiful surroundings of northern Sierra Leone.

If this sounds like the kind of crazy adventure you'd like to hear more about, we're meeting at the African restaurant L'Horloge du Sud in Matonge District from 6.30pm on Thursday (nr Porte de Namur station), or email [masked] to find out more.

Thanks guys, hope to see you there!
name: Sierra Leone Marathon Presentation

description:
The hike will be about 30km and in the hills, though they're not steep. It will be quite fast paced (6 hrs walking plus 20 mins break).

We can also do two groups, one going at a more normal pace to enjoy the scenery and fresh air :) The normal pace group can also choose a shorter and/or easier route to be sure to return before dark.

Each group will need a map. I have one already, but for the other group(s), you can buy one in the tourist information office - details here http://www.bouillon-initiative.be/

We will plan to arrive in Bouillon at 10am and leave Bouillon at 5pm.

You need to bring lunch, snacks, water and a flask of something hot if possible (it'll be cold!). Please wear waterproof shoes/boots unless you love wet socks :)

If you sign up, please mention if you're willing to drive.

Thanks!

Meeting point: on the road by the mosque in Parc Cinquantenaire, 8:20am. Meeting point in Bouillon: rue de la poulie, Bouillon.You will find a place to park just after crossing the bridge from the town.

Car 1: Mehdi: Shona, Roisin, Albane, Shafaq

Car 2: Seb: Andon, Dagmara, Alice, Nina

Car 3: Ulrike, Hannah, Bogdan

Fast group: Shona, Roisin, Mehdi, Seb, Ulrika, Hannah, david

description:
Car-pooling table:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Ah-c04Ij717GdDV4THNNNnlvSU0yR21MSktGZmVBNVE&usp=sharing

As usual,

DRIVERS: please indicate time and place of departure. I'm assuming we're travelling with 4 ppl/car; if you can take a 4th passenger, please indicate.

PASSENGERS: pick a driver

ALL: indicate phone number for any last-minute coordination

 

This is my second favourite run after the Scheveningen-Zandvoort and the first ten miles I’ve ever run (not that I did many of those).

The whole run takes place along a canal, on flat terrain, very enjoyable for those who don’t crave hills and ideal for anyone used to running 10K and wanting to challenge/test themselves before moving on to a half marathon.
Cars can be parked approx 500 m from the finish line, according to organizers, and there’s a bus service to take runners to the starting line. Last year a bag (with extra layers etc.) could be dropped at the start and redeemed after the race, I imagine this year will be no different. Both start and finish have slightly changed locations, so I can’t comment on the new ones, I’m guessing it will be an improvement (last year’s facilities were spartan at best, but that didn’t take anything away from the joy of the event, driving back right after the race was no problem). No medal was envisaged but we did get both beer and a flowery plant. Yup.
Registration is 10 eur if done by Jan 3rd, 15 after that and until February 24th.

So, who’s in?

Info here: http://www.oostendebruggetenmiles.be/CMSPage.aspx?lng=NL&content=152 (in Dutch, the English version doesn’t seem to have been updated yet). It should be fairly comprehensible, but if anybody needs assistance feel free to ask.
Number bibs must be picked up in Brugge: Sint-Lodewijkcollege, Gerard Davidstraat 57, 8000 Brugge (that is to say at the FINISH, not the start, that's where you leave you cars too).
name: Oostende-Brugge Ten Miles

description:
This week the BANFF mountain film festival going on, whereby they are screening short films about various mountain adventures:

- skiing&boarding to Taiko drums rhythm

- white water rafting in New Zealand

- rock climbing in Yosemite

- journey across Antarctica etc.

 

Usually these film are on one hand interesting because of their topic, plus are spectacular in terms of sight&sound.
Here is the link to the BANFF site, check the trailers out: http://www.banff.be/

Unfortunately tickets are sold out for all screenings in Brussels, but tickets are available for the screening on Saturday night in Braine-l'Alleud (around Waterloo), that is where I am going to as well, if you are also interested we can meet up there. They also host screenings later on in March around Belgium (Gent, Antwerp, Hasselt etc).

Peter

description:
--- Teams are set! You'll find the important information on the race website www.scheveningenzandvoort.nl and our carpooling and team table Scheveningen-Zandvoort Doc. ---

After-race lunch: we have a reservation (15.30) at:

DUNA Bloemendaal
Zeeweg 80
2051 EC Overveen (Bloemdaal aan zee)

Tel.:[masked]

Less than 200 meters from the finish, according to Google, so we can just leave the cars there.

The yearly beach marathon between Scheveningen (Den Haag) and Zandvoort (towards Amsterdam) will take place on March 17 and we should definitely be there again! It takes place entirely on the beach, which makes for a great experience, and it can be run individually or in relay teams.

There are 3 different categories to sign up: individuals (€75), teams of 2 (€125 per team) and teams of 3-7 (€150 per team). Early registrations until February 1 pay €25/40/25 less. Spots are limited to 500 and may fill up quickly as they are already seeing many signups.

Registration is here: www.inschrijven.nl

If you're going for the relay type, getting your teammates to the right spot at the right time is important. Last March our team of 5 found it practical to do this with 2 cars, dropping off and picking up our runners as we drove from one relay point to the next. Refreshment stands on the beach serve as these relay points, and usually there are parking lots close by.

Distances between the points are roughly 12, 6, 6, 6, 7 and 5 km.

Let's gather teams (or sign up individually) with team captains (who will register them) and hit the beach!

Our spots are now limited and there's a waiting list if more people want to join. Drivers will be given preference.
name: Beach Marathon Relay

2. We'll return to the arch, stretch and then continue (at 8:30) with a short but more challenging part. 12 times 30/30 second intervals and a cool-down lap. description:
This is actually an event hosted by the skating group 'RouliRoula' that I'm active with. Its a nice bunch of folks and they propose a leisurely paced skate around the countryside near Lier. The route can be seen here (http://www.rouliroula.com/forum/gpx.php?id=1398) and full details can be found here (http://www.rouliroula.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=31&t=12270). The route is flat and we'll stop for a picnic and soak up some sun along the way.
I propose to meet at the white knight at Montgomery at 9:45am.

What to bring:
Skates (obviously!)  - Inline, quads, like you want! (Hell you can follow by bike if you want!) ;-)
Small Backpack with the things you will need (food, water!)
Dress accordingly they reckon it will be warm! Don't forget, whatever you bring you have to skate with and carry...
This should be doable by most (but not absolute beginners).
Feel free to ask if you want more info.
(anyone who signs up here i will update the forum of RouliRoula so they know to expect us).

Since there are many ideas floating around and we'd need to have a clear roadmap, let's meet to discuss in person.

This is the perfect follow-up to the run Matt posted (http://www.meetup.com/Brussels-Runners/events/119060182/) and fits in perfectly with his suggestion to grab burgers/drinks afterwards.

So, all interested please sign up here so that we know how big a table we need (for the preceding run, please sign up separately so that they know how many people to await).

Sportive greetings,

Wael

description:
Dust off your skates, bike or Long-board and give the 2013 Brussels Roller-Bike Parade a try!

EVERY Friday evening from June 7th to September 27th (exception June 28th), weather permitting, the streets of Brussels will once again be full of the sights and sounds of hundreds (sometimes many hundreds!) of skaters, cyclists and now also long-boarders!

The event is typically split into two parts, the first hour weaves its way from Place Polaerts (in front of the Palais de Justice) along and through the relatively flat streets of Louise, Chatelain and the city side of Uccle, reaching Toison d'Or for the first pause. This first section is ideal for beginners to be able to give the parade a try (Being able to brake sufficiently is advisable though!).

After the break the pace can step up a little and some hills and tunnels can be found on the routes. Help is on hand for anyone getting into difficulties!

The parade starts rolling at 8pm sharp (recommend you arrive some time before to be sure you're ready to move off!) and generally arrives back at the start point around 11pm. For those only wanting to do the first section, its not far from Toison d'Or back to the start point. For those
who continue on, there is always a bus that you can hop on and off if you want to skip certain parts or just get too tired!

Leading the pack is a disco truck that will provide plenty of watts of music power to give that party atmosphere!

For the last few years the parade has also been joined by cyclists, long-boarder’s and even unicyclist’s! - this year will be no exception (the bike section follows the skaters), so even you can't or don't want to skate, you can still join in.

These events are open to all, from kids to grand-parents!

Safety first:
The parade is flanked by staff (which I am a member of so look out for me!) and police who keep the traffic away and help to make sure no one is left behind. There are first aiders and even an ambulance (not wanting to scare!), should they be needed. Everything is done to ensure your safety, but take precautions. helmets and knee, elbow & wrist guards are recommended kit. Best advice I can give for tackling hills is not to let your speed get above your comfort zone, start to brake before you feel you’re out of control. Watch out for pot-holes in the road surface (occasionally we cross over tram-tracks and cobbles, these are kept to a minimum, but keep your eyes peeled – normally such parts of the course will be high-lighted by the staff).

If you've never tried this then make sure to give it a go this year!

For those without skates there is the possibility to rent (for a small fee) from the start point (look for the black van from ‘TWIN’ shop). I Recommend that you turn up early to ensure they have your size though.

The weather is not always behaving in our favour, so be sure to check the website for the status.
Each week around 6pm on the day the event will be confirmed or cancelled (if weather conditions are not appropriate) via the website:
www.belgiumrollers.com

You can also find further information (actually sometimes a little more accurate!) on http://www.rouliroula.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=295 This is the forum of the local skating club, mostly in French, but you can find most topics on here for anything skate related in the region.

If anyone needs more information, then give me a call or send me an email. As part of the Roller staff, I will be there blocking the streets most weeks :-)

Right, that's my 'PR' duties done - Enjoy!

Matt
[masked]

ps. There are also parades weekly in Namur and Hasselt and occasionally also in Tournai, Leuven, Tienen, Oostende, Charleroi, Nivelles, Antwerp and Brain L’Alleud - more details of those will be on the website.
name: Roller Bike Parade - Season debut 2013! **CONFIRMED!**

description:
For those among us who also like to ride our bikes, let´s do an easy bike day trip around Brussels, which might include swimming in Leuven.

The proposed route is Brussels - Tervuren- Leuven - Brussels all along the bike paths along the road followed by a nice path along a river from Tervuren. The round trip is around 60 km and it is easy-moderate level.

We could then head to a lake for a pic-nic and perhaps a swim :) before heading back to Brussels.

Bring plenty of water 2-3 litres and some food for the picnic. Being Sunday and Belgium, it might be highly probable not to find nothing open to get food although in the lake some kind of restauant or shops can be expected.

VTT - vélo tout terrain - required. Weather forecast as of today provides for a PArtly Cloudy and bright day, with some showers in the morning and 21 degrees :) Si bring sun protection and a hat as well! Dont let the early morning showers confuse you :)

description:
Ever wanted to experience the nightless night of Finnish summer? Ever wanted to try running a marathon at night?

Now you can do those two at the same time, and see the Santa Claus as well!!

On 15th of June 2013 SantaClausMarathon takes place in Rovaniemi in Lapland, Finland. Participants can do both, full and half marathons, as well as a 12 km run, which all will be taking place on the Arctic Circle.

Finnair flies from Helsinki to Rovaniemi. Cost of flight is around 100 euros, if booked now (excluding the travel cost to Helsinki!). The marathon registration costs 40 euro when done before 28 May. In addition, the organizing association can book a hotel at discount price. It also organizes other activities.

Website: http://www.santaclausmarathon.com/cgi-bin/wafnet3.pl?id=208&kid=2

 

Participation fees can be paid online. First send an email to info@santaclausmarathon.http://img1.meetupstatic.com/img/clear.gifcom with a following information
- First and Last name of the participants
- Distance and category, team (in our case, Brussels Runners ;-) )
- Birth year, address and email
- T-shirt size

After you have done registration pay to the organisers via online bank

Account: FI[masked]
BIC: NDEAFIHH
Receiver: SantaClausMarathon

Write on the note: Name and the category
name: Santa Claus Maraton 15.6.2013

description:
Here’s another exciting opportunity: trying the thrill of a triathlon without having to swim, cycle and run the entire distance.
There are two options:
1/4 triathlon consisting of:
- swimming: 1000 m (time limit: 1h)
- cycling: 40 km (time limit: 2h30)
- running: 10 km (time limit: 1h30)
This can be done either individually or as a relay: 1 swimmer, 1 cycler, 1 runner.
Start at 12.
Cost:
- individual participation: € 55 (incl. chip + functional T-shirt)
- relay team € 95 (incl. chip + functional T-shirt).

1/8 triathlon consisting of:
- swimming: 500 m (time limit: 45m)
- cycling: 20 km (time limit: 1h30)
- running: 5 km (time limit: 45m)
This can be done either individually or in a team. In the latter case all team members will have to carry out all three activities and the end time will be calculated when the last runner crosses the finish line.
Start at 10.
Cost:
- individual participation: € 30 (incl. chip + functional T-shirt)
- team participation (min. 3, max. 5 people) € 120 (incl. chip + functional T-shirt).

Online registration until June 6th.
Registration on the spot possible on June 22nd/23rd.

All info here (NL/FR): http://www.antwerptriatlon.be

Here’s a table for participants to indicate whether they’d like to take part individually or in a team: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Ah-c04Ij717GdDBzRlhieWdFM0VPZDRmVlo2YlFFdVE&usp=sharing

Let's see how many brave runners we have!
name: Antwerp triathlon

description:
Hallo Hallo,

This sunday there will be instructor-led longboarding classes in Bois de la Cambre (By the Kiosk... ).

First what is a longboard? It is just a skateboard but a bit longuer and for grown-ups. It is used for different purposes: Crusing (Commuting...), Downhill (Not for now!!), carving and freeride.

Two videos to give you a glimpse of what longboarding is about: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXqmRAUsn9U
http://vimeo.com/24195442

The course is 60min, and there are 2 time slots, the first at 10, the second at 11h15 and a third one if there is a need to.

If you have your own gear, perfect! Otherwise you can rent the material on site and there is enough for 8 persons per session so be quick. Total beginners are welcome, and if you need an advice on what type of board you need, can be provided as well.

IMPORTANT:
To validate the registration, you need to fill in the form below:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/170IYbjJESUv34jrwTxWrXRBR7h7P4tfdxMlaMJ9S6Po/viewform

Then you'll be contacted by the instructor to give you a confirmation.
name: Longboarding classes! (Yes Finally)

description: We can meet at the Tram Museum and then follow the Green Way to Stockel. From there people can either take the train back or can run through the parks back to the Tram Museum. All in all shouldnt be any further than 10k
name: Run on the Green Way

description:
**Car pooling doc: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AtMb8EO63oVTdHFXNGJ2UlpFa0FpUUs5MklxbTFDMUE#gid=0

The start point we're aiming for is:

Battelse Bergen 4,
2800 Mechelen (Google maps!)

 

I’ve been going to propose this for some time and now the weather is getting better :-s I can organise it!
Proposal is this, a few hours skating by the canals in Mechelen. The paths there are flat, smooth, obstacle free (away from traffic) and distance can be decided depending the group.
I guess the aim of this is to reach out to those of you who have skates, want to skate, but are not as confident on them to tackle something like a Roller-Parade just yet. Being flat, no hills to worry about and with no major obstacles or need to have to stop rapidly, if you’re ok to skate in a straight line un-aided, then this is just the sort of practice session you need… Should be a fun relaxed pace, that will allow you to build up your confidence/skill and I’m available for any tips/advice if needs be.
Only issue will be to get there – it’s a car ride (though will check if its possible to find a start near a train station). I will have a couple of places in my car, but if someone else with a car is joining then all the better.
Meeting point – by the White Knight at Montgomery round-about, 6.30pm (negotiable depending the group). Will take 20-30mins to get to the start point (depending the traffic conditions), but with the light nights, we should still have a good few hours available – will try to find a bar to have a drink or grab a bite afterwards :-)
Recommend you wear a helmet and knee/elbow/wrist protections – don’t forget your skates of course and maybe a small backpack for shoes and a bottle of water ;-)
So come on – give it a try ;-)

Pace, around 10 km/h. We could go for brunch afterwards. Belga at Flagey has worked in the past.
name: 10 km track in Fôret de Soignes

description:
We will do about 10k at a 10km/hr pace, and much of the route is on trails in the park. Should you be scared of long distances, Saana will be doing a shorter run, approximately 5 km.

Afterwards, and this time truly meaning it, Jeff will lead some stretching and boot camp exercises to those who are hungry for more sweat and tears.

Should there be enough willingness, we can try to organise a brunch somewhere near-by. This will be decided on the spot.

venue.name: Ferry landing in Bois de la Cambre

name: Saturday run + brunch

description:
Why attending Festival Trail Semois ?

With 3 trails, 2 nordic-walkings, concerts and meals, Festival Trail Semois is THE funny gathering of all Belgian, Netherlanders, French, German en Luxembourger trailers.
Our wish for 2013 is also to make participants aware of their environmental responsability.
As in previous years, Festival Trail Semois will keep his social and solidarity goals and benefits will be transferred to an association against cystic fibrosis (mucoviscidose)
Trails :

* FTS 55 Km : : 55 km and nearly 1.500m of elevation gain. Start on saturday 6 July at 11.00 AM
* FTS 28 Km : : 28 km and 700m of elevation gain. Start on saturday 6 July at 13.00
* FTS 16 Km : : 16 km and 400m of elevation gain. Start on saturday 6 July at 14.00
* Nordic Walking (28) : 28 km and 700m of elevation gain. Start on saturday 6 July at 11.10
* Nordic Walking (16) : 16 km and 400m of elevation gain. Start on saturday 6 July at 13.10

Inscription : http://www.festival-trail-semois.be/inscriptions.php
name: TRAIL SEMOIS - 28 KM

description:
Let's get back to some interval training.

As usual, meet up under the flag. After warming up, we will run on the usual closed loop. So all paces are welcome.

Today's formula :
2x (8x (35’’ Very fast – 25’’ slow)
4' recovery between the two sets.

A recovery lap around cinquantenaire and some stretching.

Anyone interested in joining?

description: Another beginners' run for those who have just taken up running, or just want to take it easy. We will meet up under the arch in the middle of the park and have a 30-40 minute run, followed by stretching.
name: Beginners' Run in Cinquantenaire Park

description:
A bit longer and more specific session.

(1h20)
20’ slow warming up, low heart rate
5x (5’ fast + 5’ slow)
10’ recovery, cool down heart rate.

"Fast" will off course not be "interval training-fast", probably just around 175 of hear rate.

Maybe not for the total beginner, but as long as you can run for more than 1 hour, this should be perfectly ok. I plan to start with the 10km track, and continue with the 5 km track to finish. Total beginners could register as well, and run separately on the 10 km track. Blue arrows are not very difficult to follow.

Perfect to get the saturday-night beers out of your system ;)
name: Long session in forêt de Soignes

description:
Hi runners!
who's up for a 15km run on a new side of Brussels - in Laeken.
the route yet has to be fixed, but Arno will help for that! =)

We will be going through beautiful forest paths.
We start in Shaerbeek (Gare de Schaerbeek is a bit further North than Gare du Nord, lots of trams go there), then cross over the canal and into the greenness.

Please suggest a time or a route that you prefer if this doesn't suit you, it's flexible.

description:
172km Brussels to Koksijde (Belgian coast)...
This is actually something from my skating club... The mental among us are doing this route, all in one day. Start will be 6.30am (exact details to follow) and aim to be in Koksijde late afternoon. Not sure if there are any skaters amongst you up for this, but maybe some of you bikers want to come along?
The pace will be constant around 20-25Kmp/h, a stop for lunch and return by train.
Will fill in all the details Later :-)

Some more details here (in French):

http://www.rouliroula.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=145&t=12500
name: one for the serious bikers...

description:
Hello everyone,

Who will like to join for a kayak event this Sunday at 10 AM for a descent of the Lesse of 21 km… I made a reservation in advance for 10 persons for classics doube kayaks with all in formula (20,50 per person) as they expect lots of people.

This is the website for more details:
http://www.dinant-evasion.be/en/lesse-kayaks.html?IDC=37

Please take some sandwiches and drinks with you so that we can stop and enjoy.

If you will like to join please let me know as soon as possible. If you will like to have another type of Kayak please specify it. If I need to change the reservation should be done tomorrow.

I suggest that we meet there at 9.45 outside in the left side of the main entrance.

Please indicate if you come by car and if you have places over or if you need a ride.

Hope to see you Sunday,
Laura

[masked]
name: 21 KM Kayak in the area next to Dinant

description:
HY, Badri and I will meet this Sunday by the main entrance of the Atomium for a +- 40 km hike on Promenade Verte (greenway). If you’ve never heard of it, it's a 63k route for bikers and hikers all around Brussels with signs to show you the way. We chose Promenade Verte so that if somebody is tired or has to leave, there will always be a bus or a metro nearby as it's really a circle around the city. I did it biking and realized I actually didn’t know Brussels! It’s full of hidden places, green or urban or even industrial (some parts you will find quite ugly but some others are surprisingly beautiful). It’s also the chance to go through ‘communes’ we usually never go to.
Finish should be in Uccle or Watermael Boitsfort depending on our shape! We’ll miss the nice Woluwe section of the Promenade but Susie already takes some of you there in the evening ;)
There will be a Delhaize after 10 km if you need to ‘refuel’ and we’ll probably fall upon some other supermarkets otherwise.
We’ll depart at 1:30 pm sharp as we have a long way to go so please try and be there between 1:15 and 1:30.
name: 40 k hike to discover hidden Brussels

Since I don't know brussels well, whoever is up for it - please choose a trail!

suggestions welcome!

description:
A bike tour to the best beer of the world: Westvleren

A nice tour is proposed in West Flanders, and an unique chance to buy the world known beer Westvleteren brewed by monks at Saint Sixtus Abbey. You can only buy from them and it seems that when going walking or by bike, you have higher chances to buy it :)

http://www.sintsixtus.be/eng/brouwerij.htm

The distance to Vleteren is quite long as to make it in one go from Brussels (150 km), so here is the proposed planning:

a) Take a train from Brussels to Ypres - around 1h 55min and from them make a bike tour in the area, visiting the abbey in the afternoon and enjoying also lunch in the area. Dont know if renting a bike is possible there, so plan to bring your own bike!

Trains depart Gare du Midi every hour around half past (7h30, 8h30, 9h30...)

b) If somebody volunteers, we can rent or take cars and transport the bikes in bike carriers and drive all the way to Vleteren.

The trip can only be done in Saturdays. According to the info in their website, Sundays the beer shop is closed.

You should know that this beer is impossible to get it at supermarkets or bars. They only produce small quantitites and sell in an exclusive way to keep the quality (and price) high. Normally, they only sell upon reservation and limited amounts, but I heard this is only for cars and if going by bike or walking you can also get the small 6-8 packs (not crates, though).

venue.name: The abbey of Saint Sixtus of Westvleteren

name: Bike ride for beer lovers: meet the best beer of the world

If there are many of us, I suggest we split into two groups - one that wants to keep up a high pace, and the other that prefers a little slower pace. That way we don't lose anyone on the way!

See you all there , don't forget your smiles!

description: Dodentocht team meets again for a practice hike before D-Day. Join us if you like! We’ll make a loop departing somewhere between Bois de la Cambre and Wiener (we’ll post final details on Thursday morning), crossing Forêt de Soignes to Château de La Hulpe and back. We’ll make one break at La Taverne de l’Homme bleu in the castle garden for a drink/snack. We will try not to stop too much and walk at a brisk pace. Full distance will be 25-30 k but for the ones who prefer, it is possible to stop the hike midway at the castle and walk 1k to La Hulpe train station back to Brussels. It’s a 39 minute ride and it’s direct to Central Station. Train leaves every hour at 37 (15:37, 16:37 etc).

name: La course des sources

description:
Promenade Verte is a 63 km hiking and cycling path around Brussels. It goes on cycling paths or small side roads and touches an many parks, passes through forests and meadows with cows and horses.  http://www.routeyou.com/route/view/268735/randonnee-a-velo-promenade-verte.fr 

We will do the full cycle clockwise starting and ending at the Atomium.  The track is divided into 3 parts.

Prologue 15km: From Atomium to Metro Vandervelde in a fast pace pace.

Moderate ride with picnic 30km: A group from the Meetup-group HELLO Events will join and we will do a picnic. Starting at Metro Vandervelde going to Metro Erasmus.  

Final 20km: Going back through the western part of town to the Atomium in a fast pace. 

What should you bring:

- sun screen and rain cover (Summer in Brussels)

- blanket, food and drinks to share for the picnic 

- your mobile phone 

- a helmet is recommended

I will bring a pump and a basic repair set.
name: Promenade Verte - cycling around Brussels 63km + picnic
